mortality.note: Conquest period (1830-1875): 500k-1M dead, population halved. Independence war (1954-1962): 300k-1.5M Algerians killed. Torture systematic during independence war. 2 million displaced into camps.

rationales.systematic_intensity: 132-year colonial occupation with military conquest, land seizure, and suppression of resistance.
rationales.profit: Settler colonialism: French settlers (pieds-noirs) took prime agricultural land.
rationales.ideology: Mission civilisatrice ideology, but primarily territorial expansion and settlement.
rationales.complicity: French state, military, and settlers all benefited. Algerian resistance brutally suppressed.

analysis.pattern_note: 132 years of occupation. 'Algérie française' - settler colony where 1M Europeans ruled 9M Algerians. Torture institutionalized during independence war (gégène electric torture). France still struggles to acknowledge crimes - called 'events' not 'war' until 1999. Population halved during conquest, then halved again fighting for independence.
analysis.root_causes: Imperial expansion, settler colonialism, strategic Mediterranean control

sources.title: A Savage War of Peace: Algeria 1954-1962
sources.author: Alistair Horne
